caption: Delicious and unique food. I thought I had tried every single Italian dish but I was wrong! :)
Best panelle in Brooklyn! Bread is always delicious. Eggplant parm was perfect. Salad are great. Everything I tried was a 5/5 !!! Highly recommended
Terrific restaurant! I won't hesitate to recommend this restaurant to all of my co-workers and relatives.
Really good food, excellent service, loved our 1st time eating here. We will be back!
Everything is so delicious ar Amuni

Ate in the back patio a few weeks ago. Owner is a nice guy. Food is fresh, menu changes daily, great ingredients, excellent quality control. Going back tomorrow, really looking forward to it. As an Italian, I can confirm this is far above average, even by Brooklyn standards.
**Ordered takeout during COVID pandemic  Food *Panelle Special (panini bread) - good; hint of lemon in taste *Muffuletta (panini bread) - good

Excellent Sicilian food, cute restaurant, keeping up with the times in the back yard.  Must have the carciofi fritti. A very welcome addition to Bay Ridge!  Heads up - this is NOT a red sauce joint.  I love a chicken parm as much as the next guy and there are plenty of good joints for that in Bay Ridge.  That's not what you're going to get here.   You're going to get excellent regional Sicilian food.  Went here a few weeks ago just the wife and me and had very much enjoyed it.  Came back last night for a big party with family for my birthday.  This place is an exciting addition to Bay Ridge!!  We basically ordered everything on the menu, and everything was delicious.  The caponata was not too sweet or tomato-eyl, the arancini were perfect, the ricotta di pechora, insulate di finocchio and insult verde (pistachios, YO!) ... all were delightful to the palate.  The panel sandwich, muffuletta, sfincione (with and without anchovies) and the pasta al forno.  All very, very good.  Vincent said he carries tripe on occasion, and he'll do a pasta con sarge for St. Joseph's day.  So in advance of the big party I asked him to have an order ready for my dad.  Look - I'm not a big fan of tripe, most aren't, but that's not the point.  The point is Vincent was enthusiastically accommodating and most importantly, serving tripe says a lot about the grit of the restauranteur behind the shop.  Thank you Vincent!  The menu is small but they only just opened before the world ended in March 2020, so give them some time and I'm sure they'll expand.  But it doesn't matter because everything here was excellent.  That carciofi fritti with pesto mayo (trust me, it's delicious) and the pasta al forno are the bee's knees.  The restaurant is charming and proud in a simple way, the food is great, the service is excellent.  Thanks for a wonderful evening, Vincent, and many, many more to come.
AMAZING food. Lovely owner. Great setting. Brooklyn is lucky to have you.
Lovely backyard, delicious food, first time I feel like I can say I was relaxed at a restaurant in months. Will be back soon.

Best cappucino ever!  Owner is welcoming, friendly and great cook!  Fried artichokes were excellent.  Lovely garden and inside very pleasant Italian ambiance.  Looking forward to going back many times for lunch, dinner and/or coffee and dessert.  Serves wine and beer as well.
Exceptional rice balls in a neighborhood where the rice balls are highly available. Strongly recommend trying.

I wanted to go there before the lockdown. Oh well, ordered food to go tonight and it was fabulous.  As a Sicilian who grew up eating riceballs and traveling to Sicily every year I can say that the riceballs were excellent. I loved the fried artichokes and last but not least the grilled chicken with eggplant was top notch. When the lockdown is over I will be back. And if it goes a lot longer I will order take out very soon.
Had the best food at Amuni’s today. Everything was so delish. You must go❤️❤️
(Translated by Google) Very good!!!  (Original) Buonissimo!!!
Fantastic Sicilian restaurant.    So lucky we have them.   Vincent is a perfect host and whatever we ordered was very delicious...)

Delicious Sicilian food. The caponata and the rice balls were as good as my grandma used to make. The fried artichokes at the table next to me looked to die for. I prefer the panelles at Joe’s of Avenue U, but you can’t beat the service here. The owner was so accommodating, friendly, and passionate about his food. The place is decorated nicely. Go!! I want Amuní to stay in business

Learn a phrase today. Amuni or let's go!! Also experienced a great restaurant. The chef is so inspiring who came a long way. From cooking to live to living to cook, I am totally moved.  The food is amazing. I can't believe all the way to make eggplant. Eggplant with cheese panini is the killer here. The rice ball blown my mind away. The generousity of them host an event for us is out of this world. New York needs more of these mom and pop shop. People needs to stop going to that McDonald's across the street and try some real food here. The fried artichoke needs to be a thing.  The space can fit up to 30 spots and it's beautifully decorated. I love the family tree photo and the exposed wall. They have a backyard in the springtime.
Great eggplant Parmesan sandwich - tasty, not sloppy or greasy.

We went to the grand opening where we got to sample the entire menu. This was a great way to promote this new restaurant. Every single thing we tried was excellent! All of the appetizers, paninis, and the cannolis were amazing. I did not expect such great food. This is a small place with a small menu, but worth trying for authentic Italian food! Highly recommend.
Just came back from here! Food is super amazing! Owner is super friendly! Food is delicious and fresh!

Love this place! Def been missing in Bay ridge, owner is super nice. Everything was so fresh. Canolis were light and delicate. Caponata was rich, good balance of flavor. Sfincioni had a great texture, crisp bottom, airy middle, rich sauce, perfect toppings. If you want authentic, make sure to ask for anchovies, they chop them in the sauce as it should be. Super clean also!
